resources.string-array:
"Creating a bot in discord is quite an easy process. First you need to go to

https://discordapp.com/developers/applications/

and click 'New Application'.

After you give your bot a name, you will be able to change your bot profile image, bot descriptions and many more details.

Click 'Bot' on the left sidebar. Then click 'Add Bot'.

Now you can get your bot's token by using the 'Click to Reveal Token' button under your bot username or simply click 'Copy' and token will be copied to your clipboard directly."
"Keywords are used to create more dynamic messages for your commands. Here is a list of some of the available ones. More information will show you a full list.

$name (compatible with all, except member leave and ban) - This mentions the user who triggered the command

$channel - Adds the channel name to the message
(Only compatible with type: Channel Message Received)

$server - Adds the server name to the message
(Not compatible with type: Private Message Received)

$message - This adds the content of the message sent.
(Not compatible with types: User Ban, Leave, Join, or Reaction Add)

$rollnum(min,max) - This generates a random number where you replace min with the smallest number and max with the largest one.
$date (Compatible with all) - The current date.
$avatar (Compatible with all, except leave and ban) - The current avatar of the user who called the command.
$defaultAvatar (Compatible with all, except leave and ban) - The default avatar of the user.
$memberCount (Not compatible with pm received) - Gives the number of members currently in the server.
$serverCreateTime (Not compatible with pm received) - Gives the time the server was created."
More keywords available on help site.
"It is important to know that the bot must be reset for command and status changes to take place.

By default when the app is in sleep mode the bot will not respond 100% of the time. If you want to allow the bot to function as intended while dozing you must disable battery optimization for the app.

1. Go to your Settings app

2. Find the app.

3. Change the battery setting from 'Optimize' to 'Don't Optimize'

*Steps may vary for different phones."

string-array.name: commandTypes
string-array.item: プライベートメッセージ
リアクションを付ける

resources.string: コマンドのタイプを選択して
チャネルメッセージを送信

プライベートメッセージ
ステータス：オフライン
ホスティングしている時、ボットのアバターです。
ホスティングしています。

コンフィグは消しました。

コマンドのコンフィグをセーブしました。
Message is required for action Channel Message
Message is required for action Private Message
Command field is required for type Channel Message
Command field is required for type Private Message

```あなたは追放許可がありません。```
```あなたはBAN許可がありません。```
```あなたは通知オフ許可がありません。```
Delete X value field must have a number of 0 to 99
空っぽな埋め込みメッセージを送信できません。
バックしたあと、コマンドの変化をすべて削除されます。

Command types are what is done by a user to trigger the command.
Message Receive happens when a user sent a message in server.
Private Message is that a private message was received by user.
Member leave, join, and ban all happen when a user does one of those things.
Reaction Add is when a reaction is added by a user to a message in a server.

Command is what the user has to send for the bot to react to these types for the actions to occur.

Actions are what is done by the bot when the event is triggered by a user.
Here is where you put your bot token given by Discord to host the bot. Commands must be added before hosting and changes to commands while hosting will only be seen when the bot is rehosted.
「Server Members Intent」を可能にして下さい。
Something happened loading bot, bot may still be up
メッセージのIDを要する：
送信したあと、コマンドのメッセージを削除。
Xが含まれている場合は、メッセージを削除する：
コンフィグを読み込む
Loading a configuration will not save your current configuration. All changes in the currently loaded configuration will be lost. Do you want to load this configuration?
This is the command list, press the floating action button to add a command. When commands are added you can edit by pressing them, and delete them by swiping them.
